definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: All voting systems are open to tampering and error.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投票系統都能被人做手腳或出錯。

sentences.english: Reading articles written by native English speakers as they make minimal mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 看本土人仕筆下的文章，他們出錯的機會較低。

sentences.english: Like Dong, Wintour thinks she is never wrong.
sentences.chinese: 與董明珠一樣，溫圖爾認爲自己從不出錯。

sentences.english: The skip bombs were fused at fifteen seconds there was no room for error.
sentences.chinese: 跳彈的引信只有15秒，沒有任何出錯的餘地。

sentences.english: However, if the transaction dies due to instance failure, block-level recovery makes a row available before the entire transaction is recovered.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果該事務由於數據庫實例出錯的原因死掉了。

sentences.english: It means a lot more when you do your mid-term, you're worried about the errors.
sentences.chinese: 在你期中考試的時候，你擔心出錯。

sentences.english: Their pay was late because of a computer bungle.
sentences.chinese: 他們的工資晚發了，是由於計算機出錯。

sentences.english: Variable 79 has invalid number of steps -1.
The situations we face are so complex that no one can guarantee no mistakes at all.
sentences.chinese: 我們面對的情況如此複雜，以致無人能始終都不出錯。

sentences.english: This increases the chance of both mistakes and lawsuits.
sentences.chinese: 這增加了出錯和訴訟的可能。

sentences.english: But make mistake as a result of the data of time machine, take little a surname to period of the Warring States.
sentences.chinese: 但由於時光機的數據出錯，把少龍帶到了戰國時期。

sentences.english: But a little innocent joy-riding goes badly wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但有點天真快樂的騎嚴重出錯。

sentences.english: The system is easy to use with low error rate.
sentences.chinese: 該系統易於使用，且出錯率低。

sentences.english: Whenever the Chinese made a mistake, the Americans cheered, which angered me greatly.
sentences.chinese: 每當中國人一出錯，美國人就叫好，這使我很生氣。

sentences.english: I could worry about what it will bring, or what could go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我可以擔心明天會發生什麼，抑或有什麼會出錯。

sentences.english: His constant blunders made him the laughing-stock of the whole class.
sentences.chinese: 他總是出錯，成了全班的笑柄。

definition: to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
many and complicated/mired in minor details
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
